description: MoldTrans-Tur sued the Chișinău City Hall in administrative litigation.
Autogara Internațională Chișinău co-sued the City Hall in the same matter.
MoldTrans-Tur sued the Municipal Council seeking annulment of unfavorable acts and an obligation to issue a favorable act.
Autogara co-sued the Municipal Council in the administrative litigation.

source: ASOCIAȚIA DE COPROPRIETARI ÎN CONDOMINIU NR. 55/319
description: The homeowners’ association participated as a third party in the case involving MoldTrans-Tur.
The Court of Appeal upheld the 2018 Buiucani judgment (decision of 7 Feb 2019).
The Supreme Court quashed the 7 Feb 2019 appellate decision (decision of 20 Nov 2019).
The Supreme Court quashed the 6 Aug 2018 first-instance judgment (decision of 20 Nov 2019).
The Supreme Court remanded the case for re-trial to the Chișinău Court (Râșcani seat).
MoldTrans-Tur filed a recourse and an acceleration request; the Supreme Court scheduled an admissibility hearing and later denied the acceleration request.
Judge Diana Stănilă is a member of the Supreme Court; her heavy docket of CSM/CSP cases influences scheduling.
Judge Vitalii Ciumac presided over connected cases (including case no. 3-4645/2019).
The Supreme Court invoked Article 6(1) ECHR on reasonable time to assess the case’s duration.
The Administrative Code governs administrative court proceedings.
The Civil Procedure Code applies supplementarily in administrative litigation.
In the separate church-property case, the Court of Appeal (Dec 2017) admitted the Metropolis’s appeal (regarding a 2003 contract).
In the same case, the Supreme Court (Jan 2017) admitted the Metropolis’s recourse and ordered a re-trial.
